title: Per-industry theming and resilient brand logo fallback

requirements.summary: Apply per-industry theme colors on industry content pages, using industry background for the top banner/hero area and industry primary (plus optional accent) for key highlights without affecting non-industry pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting each industry route in the router (/industries/corporate-enterprise, /industries/education, /industries/healthcare, /industries/manufacturing, /industries/government, /industries/hospitality, /industries/banking, /industries/training-centers, /industries/retail, /industries/live-events) shows a visually distinct theme that matches the provided hex values for that industry.
The banner/hero wrapper at the top of ContentPage uses the industry background color (not the generic bg-muted/30) for industry pages.
Industry primary color is visible in at least: page title accent styling and link/interactive highlight styling within the page content area.

For industries that specify an accent_color (Manufacturing and Banking), the accent color is used as an optional secondary highlight (e.g., subtle badge/underline/divider) without replacing the primary color usage.
Non-industry pages (solutions, about, contact, etc.) retain the existing global theme and are not recolored by industry theme logic.

file_operations.description: Apply industry theming when the provided pageId matches an industry theme: set scoped CSS variables for primary/accent/background; use background_color for the top banner wrapper (replacing bg-muted/30 only for themed industry pages); add a primary-colored title accent (e.g., underline/left rule) and an optional subtle accent detail when accent_color is present, while preserving the clean corporate layout.

Enable theme-aware styling for content within an industry-themed scope (e.g., section headings/dividers and inline emphasis) so that primary color appears in key highlights on industry pages without changing default styling for non-industry pages.

Add a scoped industry theme utility/class (e.g., a wrapper class applied by ContentPage) that uses CSS variables to style links/interactive states and optional accent treatments within the industry page content area, ensuring non-industry pages remain unaffected.

requirements.summary: Create a centralized mapping from industry page IDs to theme tokens (primary, optional accent, background) and use it via ContentPageâ€™s pageId with a safe default when missing.
acceptanceCriteria: There is a single source of truth for industry theme values (hex codes) used by the UI.
Theme selection is based on the pageId already passed into ContentPage (no hardcoded per-route styling scattered across multiple components).
If a pageId is not in the mapping, the page renders with the existing default styling (no runtime errors).

file_operations.description: Add a single source-of-truth industry theme mapping keyed by existing industry page IDs (corporate-enterprise, education, healthcare, manufacturing, government, hospitality, banking, training-centers, retail, live-events) containing primary_color, optional accent_color, and background_color hex values, plus a helper to safely fetch a theme by pageId.
Use the centralized industry theme helper to determine whether the current pageId is themed; if not found, render with existing default styles and avoid runtime errors.

requirements.summary: Add a robust header/footer logo fallback so missing/unloadable logo images render a readable brand mark (text or placeholder) without breaking layout on desktop or mobile.
acceptanceCriteria: If the logo image at BRAND.logo.path fails to load, the header and footer do not show a broken image icon and instead display a readable brand fallback (text-based or placeholder image) that preserves spacing/alignment.
The fallback works in both desktop header and mobile menu header area, and in the footer logo area.
All user-facing fallback text is in English and uses the existing brand constants (e.g., BRAND.name).

file_operations.description: Create a reusable BrandLogo component that attempts to render BRAND.logo.path and, on load failure, swaps to an accessible, layout-preserving fallback using BRAND.name (text-based brand mark and/or local placeholder asset) suitable for header/footer sizes.
Replace direct logo usage in both the desktop header and mobile sheet header area with the new BrandLogo component to prevent broken-image rendering and preserve spacing/alignment.
Replace direct logo usage in the footer with the new BrandLogo component so the fallback behavior matches the header and preserves footer layout.

requirements.summary: Ensure a clean corporate placeholder wordmark logo asset exists at the configured logo path used by the app.
acceptanceCriteria: A placeholder logo asset exists at the configured path used by the app (as defined in frontend/src/site/brand.ts).
The placeholder logo is legible at the current header/footer render size (className h-8 w-auto) and looks consistent with a clean corporate B2B design.
No backend changes are required to serve the logo; it is a static asset under frontend/public.

file_operations.description: Add the provided generated placeholder asset at the exact configured logo path so the application has a consistent corporate wordmark until a real logo is uploaded (use: frontend/public/assets/generated/logo-wordmark-updated.dim_600x160.png).
Verify the configured BRAND.logo.path points to /assets/generated/logo-wordmark-updated.dim_600x160.png and ensure BRAND.name is the authoritative English fallback brand text used elsewhere.
